content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand sidepull. From there, get bunched with high feet, flip the left to a decent undercling, bump the right hand up through a gaston to a pinch-edge, reach a left hand edge, the eventual lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there is a rock that makes for some unevenness.
content.location:
It climbs the north face of Austen in between

Mr. Darcy's Quandry

and

Other Side Motif

.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on the low shelf and a left heel hook (awkward, I know). From there, move both hands up to the next shelf, gain a right hand gaston, get your feet under you, knee bar, gain the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is great, but there is a small ... in the landing.
content.location: It climbs just left of the small tree on Austen's north face.

content.description: Start on the undercling and move out and then follow the roof before topping out. This will get better and better as it gets cleaned and sees more usage.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There's a bit of an uneven landing, but it should be okay.
content.location: It is located on the northeast side of the boulder. The downclimb is on the southeast side.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand pinch-edge and a right hand sidepull crimp. From there, dyno to a right hand sloper edge, place a high left heel hook, reach a left hand edge, then bump the hands left to a good edge, mantle onto the slab, and finish it with an easy topout.
content.protection: A pad will be fine. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the northwest section of Austen.

content.description:
I love this problem. Start on a crimp and a quasi-pinch. Move up to another good crimp with the left hand, and set your feet to make a big move to the right into an awkward, vertical rail. If you stick it, turn the vertical rail into a sidepull and move up into a small crimp. From there, it eases up for the topout.

I did give this a V5 grade simply because I found it to be more difficult than the other V5s I've work in Unaweep.
content.location: The route is right in the center of the north face. The downclimb is on the south side of the boulder and is easy to get down.

content.description: Sit start with hands matched on a large block-pinch. From there, crank with a good inverted right hand pinch, get the feet under, flip the left hand to a small undercling, stand tall to the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is great.
content.location:
Climb the north face of Austen. It is in between

Sniffy Sniffers

and

Scourge of Carpathia

.

content.description:
Afflatus Flip is short and sweet. The rock quality is fantastic, and the movement is entertaining.

Sit start with a right hand incut edge and a left hand jug undercling. From there, make a big right hand move to a three finger edge, place a left heel hook, bump the left hand up to a three finger edge, then make a move to a great left hand edge, follow to the lip, and mantel atop the boulder.

A possible linkup from this to

Pemberly Place

may be worth some effort.
content.protection: A pair of pads worked well. The landing is great, but there is a rock directly to the left of the problem. It may or may not be an issue.
content.location: It climbs just left of Mr. Darcy's Quandary on Austen's north face.
